headline: Big Ray's Mexican Monkey Bread
description: This cheesy pull-apart bread is made with refrigerated biscuit dough and jalapeno peppers for an easy spicy treat.

video.description: Spicy cheesy bread delivers the heat!
video.name: Big Ray's Mexican Monkey Bread

name: Big Ray's Mexican Monkey Bread
recipeIngredient: 1 (16.3 ounce) package refrigerated buttermilk biscuit dough, separated and each portion cut into quarters

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Prepare a 9x5-inch loaf pan with cooking spray.
Pour melted butter into a small bowl. Dip each piece of biscuit dough in melted butter to coat.

Arrange enough of the biscuit dough pieces in the bottom of the loaf pan to form a single layer; top with 1/2 cup Cheddar cheese, 1/4 cup pepper slices, and 1/4 teaspoon parsley. Repeat layering once and top with remaining biscuit dough pieces, pepper slices, and parsley flakes.
Mix remaining 1/4 cup Cheddar cheese and mozzarella cheese together in a bowl; spread over the top of the ingredients to cover.
Bake in preheated oven until golden brown, 40 to 45 minutes. Cool bread in pan for 5 minutes before inverting onto a plate to serve.

review.reviewBody: Really easy and very good! Thanks üòä
Perfect sharing for a Christmas party. I chopped sausage and cooked with onions, once cooled added to my layers. Big hit!
BIG HIT!!! LOVED!!!!! Made this monkey bread, and took it to a neighborhood social distancing get together. It was gone within minutes! So simple and easy to make! FIVE STARS!!!!
I am so pleased with this recipe! Easy and delicious! I had two layers of bread and topped both with jalepino and cheese. Everyone really enjoyed it with our 3 bean chili.
Love it. The second, third, fourth and fifth time I made this... I added a lot more pickled jalape√±o . Three times as much. Everyone loved it.
I made it exactly as shown. It was delicious!
Great use of jalapenos. I think next time I'll add garlic or garlic salt.
I think the Mexican Monkey is super okay but not too oily at all, and I have not tried one of different kinds of monkey breads yet. 3 stars for sure.
I added pepper jack cheese and it still tasted awesome. Would do this recipe again.

Made this two ways now, first time I left off the jalapenos, so all family members would eat. I was a little heavy handed with the cheese, and after I put it all in the bundt cake, I put the remaining butter over the top. 

Second time I used pickled jalapenos, and both times were delicious. Everyone loves this recipe, will be a standard in our house, as it's simple and quick.

Would definitely make it again. 
Considering adding taco seasoned ground beef the next time!
This was a winner! I over did the cheese and jalapenos but it got a lot of praise. I will make this again and add sausage.

Sooooo good ! I used a deep dish pie pan which worked perfectly (center the dough pieces, there will be a inch or so space from the edge of the pan but it spreads out when baking). I also drizzled about 1/4 stick of melted butter over the top dough, than the cheese, bake time was 30 mins. I used canned jalape√±os & the bread wasn‚Äôt hot / spicy at all. This is such a good & easy recipe to make I‚Äôm definitely going to keep it in my recipe file & will be sharing it.

Can I just say WOW?! I thought this recipe was perfect! I would not change anything! Followed recipe, it turned out perfect! Can‚Äôt wait for an opportunity to make at a family gathering! Of course it had all of my favorite ingredients; bread, cheese, jalape√±os!!

I took this to a party and everyone loved it and said I needed to bring 2 next time. I used pepper jack cheese and sun dried tomatoes instead of the jalapenos, as I don't like jalapenos. It had a nice kick without being too hot.
It‚Äôs definitely awesome to add more cheese. It should be perfect when it comes out with a nice gold edge. Such a fun party food. 5/5!
This was amazing. Thank you
yummy and ridiculously easy to make. quite cute display
Yo big ray, what up with the lack of fava beans? Added some to mine and i was the bomb. #igobananasforfava
Easy to make. You can make as spicy as you want. I also added minced onions and have used frozen bread dough/ dinner rolls.
Nice recipe, I really like this. I followed advice to cut in to eights, not quarters and tossed them in a bowl full of melted butter. Combinations of fillers are endless.

Easy to make and something different to serve with chilli or soup or as a snack. Made it for a football game, along with other apples, and it was a hit. Made it a second time and added black olive slices. Thanks for the recipe!

AWESOME! Absolutely delicious! I did need an extra Tbs. of butter for dipping. After laying out the first layer, I realized there was no way I was going to get 3 layers, so I just made 2 which meant, since all my ingredients were measured out for 3, each of the 2 layers ended up with extra toppings because I wasn't about to wrap and put anything back in the fridge. Mine took 40 minutes to bake and it came out tasty and beautiful. The only thing I did differently was to chop up my jalapeno slices a bit to provide better distribution. Wished I'd had a beer to drink with it because this stuff was hot...but soooo good.

Loved it. Easy to make. I used a fresh Serrano Chile because that's what I had. I think next time I'll add the last layer of cheese half way through the baking time. I'm sorry I didn't try this sooner since I pinned it a few years ago!
Crazy good! Surprisingly, the jalape√±os are not all that hot. Very rich, not for the day you are counting calories. Well worth the count.
Great recipe thanks!

So this is just a plateful of sinful goodness. It hits all my pleasure points for decadent snacking. Soft chewy bread! Gooy melty cheese! Bright spicy peppers! What's not to love.... except the uncooked doughy bits in the middle when you make monkey bread without using a bundt pan. I did find if you cut the biscuits into 8 pieces instead of 4 that does help and I baked the first layer of biscuits for about 10 minutes before adding the cheese and remaining layers.
Love it! I added some crumbled hot sausage, (about 1/2 lb). It was done in 30 min. I'll be making this again.
Yum! Hubby and I loved it!
This was OK...as one reviewer mentioned, too dry. And I added more cheese in hopes it would alleviate the dry factor but it fell short.
I was afraid using all that jalapeno pepper would make it way too spicy, so I cut it in half. Actually, when I make it again, I'll use the amount of jalapeno called for, as it wasn't very hot at all.
Loved this bread. So easy! I thought we had a jar of jalape√±os but no. So I used jalape√±o stuffed olives. Turned out great! Next time I'll try sun dried tomatoes. Great with soup.

I made as written but I thought this was too dry. Maybe more cheese?
Update, I made this again with more cheese, more butter, more jalape√±o and it was very good. Be prepared to double or Tripple the cheese.
Really, really FABULOUS

We used about 1.5 cups of fresh jalape√±o slices and added about a Tbsp of garlic. We only had cheddar cheese so I added an extra 1/4 cup to replace the mozzarella. We will make this again and try it with olives & sun dried tomatoes too. This will be a regular for us. Thank you!
Made it for lunch with some fresh guacamole and salsa. Easy and tasty.
Made it last week, and it was a big hit. Making it again this weekend in hopes that I can enjoy it alone.

This was very easy to make and a home run in my opinion. I used mild jalapenos, just because I didn't want it to be too hot, and followed the recipe with no modifications. I will definitely make this again. Thank you.

I made this recently for a football watch party. It was a bigger hit with me than anybody else. Turns out, the extra jalape√±os I added weren't appreciated by everyone. With the leftovers, the next day, I tore off a few pieces, sprinkled them with some shredded cheese and put them under the broiler for a few minutes. Made for excellent breakfast "cheese toast". Anyway, it's easy and delicious. I'll be making this again and again.
So delish and super easy to make!
Cooking time was about 40 mins.

Made this for Labor Day weekend. It was delicious!! We did dip it in some ranch to cool the heat down a little. I added some cayenne pepper to the spiced layers. There is so much room to change up the spices and toppings!!
This is a big hit for those who like the spicy jalape√±os - which I do. I'll be making this again for sure. This would be a good dish to bring to a party.
I've made this several times and everyone loves it. I even made this on a camping trip for a group of 6 and there wasn't anything left.
This was so easy to make and turned out perfect! I used Mexican oregano in place of the parsley.
This was really good. I made some modifications to suit what I had - made my own biscuits, used cheddar and cotija cheeses, and cilantro instead of parsley. Will make again for sure!
My family loves this and it is so quick to make. I use Marzetti's "tamed" jalapenos (drained) which are wonderful. This goes great with a brothy soup on a cold day.

5 star recipe, though I have to admit, I had saved this recipe from junior high's home economics class (many, many, many moons ago). Easy variations are to add pepper jack cheese, sausage, bacon or ham for breakfast. Turn it in to a pizza bread by adding smoke mozzarella, pepperoni or salami. Or a veggie bread by adding a variety of vegetables. This bread is so versatile and forgiving you can add anything and it turns out well! Thanks for the memories bfr610!
Very easy recipe. I send it to my granddaughter to make for her Mother and Dad.
Oh my gawd, I've died and gone to heaven!

Another great recipe bfr610, thank you! I found a can of biscuits in the fridge and knew exactly what I wanted to do with it. I thought the taste of this would compliment a large dinner salad really well, and I was correct. My SIL had just given me a jar of the fresh jalape√±os that she had canned. I drained them really well (between paper towel) and they were great in this recipe. It was doughy (in a good way), cheesy, spicy and oh soooo delicious. I won't hesitate to make this again and make it for company. I look forward to trying another one of your recipes, bfr610!
